results.content: Topics are pooly explained. Most times, the screen do not compliment the topic being explained. This entire course is text being converted to speech by a bot.
results.content_html: Topics are pooly explained. Most times, the screen do not compliment the topic being explained. This entire course is text being converted to speech by a bot.

results.content:
Show don't tell. This is the opposite of that. Here, the voice-over artists tells us things. Doesn't show us code. Just tells us everything, and then shows one giant lump of code and we're done. 

Just had a three minute section to explain selectors, where the selector is described vocally but NO CODE IS SHOWN, just what would be selected. Wow. Couldn't even be bothered to show actual selector code and then show what it selects. If the reasoning is "its too basic and everyone knows selectors already" then don't waste our time. But if it must be explained to new people, then this effort isn't effective. This was after several videos "explaining" some basics, like how to set up an editor, except not. If I didn't know this already, I wouldn't have known it after. I've programmed professionally for years, and I didn't follow it at all. 

I seriously doubt the guy doing the commentary is even technical. He's voicing over someone else's demo and pronounces things oddly. Like "javascript" is  Java [pause] Script. "CSS3" is "C" [pause] "SS3".
results.content_html:
Show don't tell. This is the opposite of that. Here, the voice-over artists tells us things. Doesn't show us code. Just tells us everything, and then shows one giant lump of code and we're done.

Just had a three minute section to explain selectors, where the selector is described vocally but NO CODE IS SHOWN, just what would be selected. Wow. Couldn't even be bothered to show actual selector code and then show what it selects. If the reasoning is "its too basic and everyone knows selectors already" then don't waste our time. But if it must be explained to new people, then this effort isn't effective. This was after several videos "explaining" some basics, like how to set up an editor, except not. If I didn't know this already, I wouldn't have known it after. I've programmed professionally for years, and I didn't follow it at all.

I seriously doubt the guy doing the commentary is even technical. He's voicing over someone else's demo and pronounces things oddly. Like "javascript" is Java [pause] Script. "CSS3" is "C" [pause] "SS3".
